details.title: This is the first assembly election after the state of Telangana was formed
details.content: The counting of votes for the Telangana assembly elections will start today at 8 am.

details.title: Visuals from Congress office in Hyderabad ahead of counting
details.content:
#Telangana: Visuals from Congress Office in Hyderabad. Counting of votes to be conducted for the state assembly elections at 8 am today. pic.twitter.com/VtSw6RkID6

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: What did the exit polls predict for Telangana?
details.content:
In its pre-poll survey, Times Now-CNX projected a victory for the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samiti with 66 seats in the 119-seat Assembly. It gave 37 seats to Congress and 7 to BJP while others were given 9.

Republic TV-Jan Ki baat gave TRS 50-65 seats and 38-52 to Congress, 4-7 to BJP and 8-14 to others. The majority mark is 60.

details.title: Who are the main contestants?
details.content:
TRS: K Chandrashekar Rao (Gajwel)

KT Rama Rao (Sirsilla)

Congress: Uttam Kumar Reddy (Telangana Congress chief, seeking re-election from Huzurnagar); Revanth Reddy (Kodangal)

AIMIM: Akbaruddin Owaisi (Chandrayangutta)

details.title: What Governor should do in case of a hung house?
details.content: Several past judgements make it clear that a pre-poll alliance must be considered as the single-largest party, and must get the first invitation to form the government. READ FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: The People's Front requested the Governor that in case no party gets a clear majority then he should first invite their alliance.
details.content: Telangana Congress chief Uttam Kumar Reddy and TJS leader Prof Kodandaram addressing the media with other Prajakutami leaders after meeting Governor ESL Narasimhan at Raj Bhavan in Hyderabad a day before the election results. (Photo | Sathya Keerthi/ EPS)

details.content: Our Resident Editor Ch V M Krishna Rao predicts three likely scenarios today. READ HERE
Vote counting is underway. Initial trends to emerge soon.

details.title: Telangana CEO clarifies on voter name ommissions, invites them to apply if they want their names to be included
details.content: Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) of Telangana Rajat Kumar said: Deletions and inclusions of a voter are made during enrolment and revision of the electoral rolls. Objections under Form No.7 are invariably invited from citizens to raise objections within seven days before carrying out deletions. Similarly, voters are required to apply in Form 6 if they want their names to be included

details.title: Telangana CEO clarifies on voter name ommissions, invites them to apply if they want their names to be included
details.content:
Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) of Telangana Rajat Kumar said: Deletions and inclusions of a voter are made during enrolment and revision of the electoral rolls. Objections under Form No.7 are invariably invited from citizens to raise objections within seven days before carrying out deletions. Similarly, voters are required to apply in Form 6 if they want their names to be included. 

READ FULL STATEMENT HERE

details.title: Early trends as on 8:40 am

CONGRESS:18

details.title: TRS leader Kavita confident of win
details.content:
K Kavitha, Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) MP: We believe people of Telangana are with us. We have sincerely worked and utilised the opportunity given to us. So I believe voters will bring us back to power, and that too independently. We are very confident about it. pic.twitter.com/fgY4EwfguZ

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: TRS leads in Hyderabad
details.content: TRS is leading in Hyderabad's Khairatabad, Jubilee Hills, Seringapally and Sanathnagar. Congress in LB Nagar.

details.title: Harish Rao leads in Siddipet
details.content: TRS leader T Harish Rao leading in Siddipet by 19,000 votes over his nearest TJS rival Bhavani Reddy after the completion of the third round.

details.title: TRS racing away to another huge win in Telangana?
details.content: One hour and a bit into the counting, it does seem like the TRS' gamble of calling for early elections is paying off. They are sweeping the state if the early trends are to relied upon. Chandrababu Naidu's attempt to turn the elections into a theatre where simple arithmetic could trump all other considerations hasn't yielded the result he was hoping for. KCR and his party at the moment are the only ruling party who look likely to retain power on Super Tuesday.

details.title: Congress trails
details.content: Congress leaders K Jana Reddy, A Revanth Reddy and Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka are trailing.

details.title: Telangana Congress' Komatireddy trails
details.content: Komatireddy Venkat Reddy is trailing in Nalgonda

details.title: KCR leads in Gajwel
details.content: K Chadrasekhar Rao leading in the 2nd round with 5,450 votes in Gajwel over Congress rival Vanteru Pratap Reddy
After fourth round of vote counting, T Harish Rao leading with 26,000 votes in Siddipet

details.title: Congress' Jeevan Reddy in trouble
details.content: Congress senior leader T Jeevan Reddy trailing in Jagtial
Congress senior and former Home minister Sabita Indra Reddy is also trailing

details.title: Congress' K Jana Reddy in trouble
details.content: In Nagarjuna Sagar, Congress leader K Jana Reddy who is seeking his seventh consecutive term as MLA, trails with 3,468 while TRS man N Narsingaiah leads with 4,429.

details.title: Akbaruddin Owaisi wins from his constituency
details.content: Chandrayangutta assembly results declared: Akbaruddin Owaisi declared winner

details.title: KCR ahead
details.content: After 3rd round of voting, KCR leading with 5,757 votes

details.title: Raja Singh leads
details.content: BJPs T Raja Singh leading in Goshamahal AC with 2737 votes after first round

details.content: KT Rama Rao leading by over 15,000 votes in Siricilla

details.title: KCR's nephew Harish Rao hopes to retain Siddipet seat
details.content: In Siddipet, T Harish Rao is leading with 45,000 votes after 7th round
TRS party workers begin celebrating outside party office in Hyderabad. (Photo | R Satish Babu/ EPS)

details.title: TRS leader M Sanjay Kumar wins in Jagtial

details.content: State BJP chief K Laxman leads in Musheerabad by 2710 votes

#TelanganaElections : Minister T Hareesh Rao @trsharish leads with 80,000 votes margin in Siddipet, KTR @KTRTRS leads with 53,000 votes in Siricilla and CM KCR leads with 20,000 votes margin in Gajwel, #ResultswithTNIE #Results2018 @NewIndianXpress

details.title: MLA A Ramesh wins from Wardhannapet
details.content: Wardhannapet TRS candidate Aroori Ramesh wins seat.

details.title: Challa Dharma Reddy of TRS wins Parakala
details.content: TRS candidate Challa Dharma Reddy wins in Parakala, beats Congress party candidate Konda Surekha.
Kukatpally TRS party candidate Madhavaram Krishna Rao wins with margin of 23,000 votes over his nearest candidate Nandamuri Suhasini, grand-daughter of late NT Rama Rao.

details.title: TRS leader Challa Dharma Reddy wins Parakala seat
details.content: TRS candidate Challa Dharma Reddy wins in Parakala, beats Congress party candidate Konda Surekha

details.title: T Harish Rao wins for the 6th time in 14 years
details.content: KCR's nephew and former minister Thanneeru Harish Rao wins from Siddipet with 1,18,699 votes.

details.title: TPCC chief calls for VVPAT verification
details.content:
Telangana Congress chief Uttam Kumar Reddy: "I am having doubts on results we're getting in Telangana ballot paper counting. We're doubting that tampering could have been done in EVMs. Slips should be counted in VVPAT. All the Congress leaders will complaint to RO officers. We will also complaint to ECI on this matter. How can TRS leaders say before counting that who will lose in elections."

Hyderabad: Congress delegation submits a complaint to Telangana Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) Rajat Kumar raising suspicions that Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) have been manipulated in the state. #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/XTCL0Dcmnb

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: KCR's son KT Rama Rao wins from Sircilla with 87, 565 votes
details.content:
Grateful, indebted & Humbled

Thanks Telangana for keeping the faith in KCR Garu & giving us another opportunity to serve you pic.twitter.com/nSwnaLz8z2

— KTR (@KTRTRS) December 11, 2018

details.title: Rajnath Singh says Mahakutami led by Congress has failed terribly
details.content:
Home Minister Rajnath Singh on #AssemblyElections2018: Nothing is yet clear from the trends. Congratulations to the MLA candidates and the political parties that are winning. But Mahagathbandhan has failed terribly in Telangana pic.twitter.com/ttONAvgGeq

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: TRS leaders register more victories
details.content:
Quthbullapur: KP Vivekananda beats Prajakutami candidate Kuna Srisailam Goud

 

Warangal West: Vinay Bhaskar wins

Dharmapuri: Eshwar Koppula wins

details.title: Congress wins Yellareddy seat
details.content: Congress candidate Jajala Surender wins in Yellareddy constituency against TRS candidate A Ravinder Reddy.

details.title: Minister Tummala Nageswara Rao loses in Palair
details.content: Tummala Nageswara Rao has lost to Congress leader Kandala Upender Reddy with 1920 votes from Palair constituency. He was the Minister for Roads and Buildings, Women and Child welfare ministries in the last TRS government. Tummala had won 2016 by-elections with a majority of over 65,000 votes.

details.title: Jupally Krishna Rao loses Kollapur AC seat
details.content: Another TRS minister Jupally Krishna Rao has lost from Kollapur AC to Congress candidate B Harshavardhan Reddy with a margin of over 10,000 votes. Jupally was Panchayat Raj and Rural Development minister in the last TRS government.

details.title: KCR wins Gajwel
details.content: Caretaker CM KCR wins Gajwel seat with 51,515 votes. KCR improved his majority from 19,366 votes in 2014.

AIMIM second-in-command Akbaruddin Owaisi was probably the first one to leave behind his opponents as early as 10 in the morning, prompting experts to declare him as winner. As the day ended, Asad's younger brother Akbaruddin won by a massive margin of over 80,000 votes against his nearest candidate BJP's Syed Shehzadi's 15,000 votes. Congress candidate Esa Obaid bin Misri languished at the fourth spot with 10.7k votes.
B Sanjay of BJP wins Karimnagar segment against Gangula Kamalakar of TRS

details.title: Party workers celebrate with 50 kg cake at TRS headquarters
Telangana Congress working president Revanth Reddy loses Kodangal seat by 9500 votes to TRS candidate Patnam Narender Reddy
Third minister from TRS govt loses seat
Third TRS minister loses seat
details.content: Tourism and Culture Minister Azmeera Chandulal has lost by a margin of 12,955 votes in Mulugu assembly to Congress candidate Dansari Anasuya (Seethakka).

details.title: Transport minister Patnam Mahendar Reddy loses Tandur seat
details.content: He becomes the fourth minister in the list of losers today.

details.title: Congress campaign committee chairman Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka wins Madhira with a majority of 3,500 votes
TDP wins Sattupalli
details.content: TDP candidate Sandra Venkata Veeraiah won Sattupalli segment with a majority of 5,000 votes.

details.title: TDP to analyse results, failure of Mahakutami
details.content: "We have to analyse the factors that contributed to the success of TRS and failure of our alliance," said Ravula Chandrasekhar Reddy, senior leader of TDP, led by Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu. "We were expecting to get more number of seats. The results are not to our expectations," Reddy told PTI.

details.title: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu congratulates KCR
details.content:
Congratulating KCR garu for winning the Assembly elections in Telangana.

— N Chandrababu Naidu (@ncbn) December 11, 2018

details.title: Naidu chooses to focus on BJP loss over alliance failure
details.content:
Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu: People recognize that BJP has done nothing in last 5 yrs and moving towards alternative. People are with us in our fight against BJP. These 5 states results will help form a strong alternative to the BJP. (file pic) #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/jxCOPoNJjJ

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: TRS wins Khairatabad
details.content: Congress turncoat and TRS candidate from Khairatabad assembly segment Danam Nagender wins with a majority of 28,219 votes against BJP's Chinthala Ramachandra Reddy. Reddy represented Khairatabad as MLA in last assembly.
KCR to address media at party headquarters Telangana Bhavan shortly.
KCR to address media at party headquarters Telangana Bhavan shortly.
T Harish Rao celebrating his victory. (Photo | EPS)
T Harish Rao celebrating his victory. (Photo | EPS)
Out of 14 assembly constituencies in erstwhile Mahbubnagar district, TRS won 13 constituencies.

details.title: KCR at party HQ
details.content:
Telangana: K Chandrsekhar Rao arrives at party headquarters in Hyderabad, he won from Gajwel constituency by over 50,000 votes. TRS is leading on 77 seats in the state. #AssemblyElectionResults2018 pic.twitter.com/Gry1skemYj

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Nalgonda
details.content: In erstwhile Nalgonda district, out of 12 constituencies, TRS won 8 and Congress won 4. In 2014, TRS had won 6 seats and Congress-CPI alliance had won 6 seats.

details.title: Warangal
details.content: In erstwhile Warangal district, TRS won 10 seats where as Congress won two. TRS improved its tally by 2 seats compared to 2014.

details.title: Khammam
details.content: In erstwhile Khammam district, TRS won only 1 seat out of 10 seats. People Front(Congress won 6 seats, TDP two seats) Independent 1 seat. Even in 2014, TRS had won only one seat.

details.title: Medak
details.content:
Out of 10 constituencies in erstwhile Medak, TRS won 9 constituencies whereas Congress candidate T Jayaprakash Reddy won from Sangareddy.

In 2014, TRS had 8 seats and Congress had 2 seats.

In 2016 by-election, TRS won Narayankhed segment pushing Congress to only one seat in the erstwhile Medak district.

KCR at the TRS meeting: I spoke to other political parties, we are going to play a crucial role in national politics.

TRS President and Telangana caretaker Chief Minister K Chandrashekhar Rao in Hyderabad: I will actively participate in national politics. pic.twitter.com/bxEkSCa6XD

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Owaisi brothers to reach AIMIM office soon
details.content: Asaduddin Owaisi is expected to address AIMIM workers at party HQ. He had promised support to KCR's government as the 'first step towards the larger goal of nation building'.

details.title: Adilabad
details.content: In erstwhile Adilabad district, 8 out of 10 constituencies have been won by TRS and one is won by Congress. In Mancheriyal constituency, counting is still going on. In 2014, Congress had won one seat, BSP had won 2 and TRS had won 7 constituencies.

details.title: Congress wins Asifabad with slim majority
details.content: With a mere majority of 276 votes, Congress candidate Attram Sakku won against TRS candidate Kova Lakshmi in Asifabad constituency. This is also the lowest margin for any victory in this assembly election results in state.

details.title: KCR slams Naidu
details.content: KCR said at his meeting: We will give return gift to Chandrababu Naidu for entering Telangana politics by entering Andhra politics.

#TelanganaElections2018 | TNIE reporter @Jay_Apoorva18 giving us updates from @trspartyonline Bhavan.
LIVE report: https://t.co/aeXczTAP6E #ResultsWithTNIE #Results2018 pic.twitter.com/xfRbutTAHh

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) December 11, 2018

details.title: Owaisi backs a non-Congress, non-BJP govt with KCR
details.content:
Asaduddin Owaisi, AIMIM: I say this with all responsibility that K Chandrasekhar Rao has all capabilities & capacities to ensure that a non-Congress govt comes into existence when the next parliament election takes place & this country requires a non-Congress & a non-BJP govt. pic.twitter.com/P0XPQ9wexk

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018
KCR says TRS will join the people of India to make the country BJP-mukt and Congress-mukt READ FULL REPORT OF HIS SPEECH HERE.
